p: In septic patients ascorbate was shown to decrease mortality especially in the hyperinflammatory subphenotype characterized by high leukocyte count (>15,000/ml) and fever (>37.5Â°C) ( 150). A meta-analysis including 1,210 patients with sepsis showed that different daily doses of intravenous ascorbate were associated with different results, and only a dose between 3-10 g/day resulted in decreased mortality, decreased need for vasopressor and mechanical ventilation, but not lower or higher doses ( 166).
